item.title: üìÉ My Obsidian Publish infinite loop. The saga of creating new problems by solving others.

item.title: üì∫ The SINGLE Template challenge (update)
item.description: I managed to go from 3 Obsidian templates down to 2 using a very basic hack. And honestly, I think I could even get to just one with a little more courage! I also added a new "time" property to my templates, getting things ready for how I plan to use the upcoming Bases plugin.

item.title: üìÉ Returning to a beloved book universe
item.description: The last time I was so deeply involved with a universe, a book universe, was when I was reading my favorite author to this day, Fernando Sabino. He would repeat sentences, ideas, and situations across all these completely unrelated stories and books, so I always thought he was talking about his life, but with a little touch of fiction. One could say that in a way, there was a universe, the author's life universe, this parallel reality with so many recognizable things that we could understand and relate to.

item.title: üì∫ Outsourcing insights to AI is probably not a good idea.
item.description: I've been thinking a lot about how tempting it is to outsource more and more tasks to these powerful AI tools. Where should we draw the line to preserve our critical thinking, insights, and so many other human qualities that are still far superior to what AI could accomplish for us?

item.title: üí¨ There's no need to call my boss.

item.title: üìÉ AI as a powerful Tool, not a Commander.
item.description: It's tempting to outsource more and more tasks to powerful AI tools. But how far should we go? Have we already reached a point where we're blindly handing over too much control? And what harm is this already doing to our growth and critical thinking?
